poem:
**Evidence Locker**

This morning the newspaper folds itself into a small room  
where a woman's name lies on a metal table,  
and the key is taken away.  

Minnesota stands in the hallway, hands empty,  
listening to boots, to clipped voices behind a federal door,  
while outside, flags whip the cold air,  
and smoke writes its brief, unreadable sentence.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "FBI takes over case of ICE agent killing US woman and cuts Minnesota’s access to evidence The FBI has taken full control of the investigation into the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Macklin Good by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency (ICE) officer in Minneapolis, it emerged on Thursday. In a statement, the Minneosta Bureau of Criminal Apprehension (BCA) said it was initially called upon to help investigate the shooting before federal officials “reversed course” and said the case would be solely led by the FBI. As it now no longer has access to the case materials, witnesses and evidence, the BCA said it had “reluctantly” withdrawn from the investigation. As tensions escalated, authorities in Minneapolis had canceled school classes across the city on Thursday amid safety concerns and rising political tension after the US citizen was killed by a federal agent during a large-scale immigration enforcement operation on Wednesday. A demonstration attended by thousands on Wednesday night went peacefully after the fatal shooting hours earlier. Scores of people bundled up in heavy coats gathered in a parking lot near a building that houses several federal agencies, including an immigration court. The crowd was chanting and holding American flags and signs calling on ICE to leave Minnesota. Police at one point threw devices releasing smoke to break up the crowd, which carried signs and shouted profanities at them. Related: ‘This is not normal’: Minneapolis on edge and angry after ICE killing of woman amid federal surge One of the protestors,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
